Muslims are only mentioned in this article because many muslim residents were awake for sahoor period(moment before sunrise to eat before they start the fast till sundown), they noticed smoke etc, and alarmed whoever they can. 
Had it not been ramadan this month, many more people would be asleep and less people to alarm them. 
They didn't do nothing that any other human wouldn't have done, but the article just mentions the point above.
Ramadan miracle...

Things could have been far worse had they been asleep also. So this isn't (and shouldn't be) about Muslims, but rather that muslims awake at that time were able to see the situation and be able to call for help when needed.

Today, when a Muslim was seen to save people which was due to religious ritual observing, some people can't appreciate it? Rather they choose to criticize the article title. Now, Muslims are in very critical state where they are seen as unsafe people. This article title lets people know a good deed of a Muslim man, we are also Human being and we are always taught to help others just like any other religion.  If you think being awake was nothing special, ok then but calling out to everyone's door- wasn't it a big thing to do? Generally in this situation, people panicks and only can think about themselves. If it was not a Muslim guy then many would have uttered sweet blessings for that man for able to save lives. Be a human first. Richard Khol we need to eat before 2:50 these days so most households would be up at 1:30-2:00 to prepare meals. Also, night prayers last from approx 10:30pm onwards so people who do longer prayers (which we usually do in Ramadan) will have been awake at midnight.

Basically, this month is called Ramadhan in the lunar calendar. Muslims fast in this month. They are required to be awake at 2am before sunrise to have the early morning meal.
